name: Jumping Jacks
instructions: Start with your feet together and your arms at your sides. In one motion, jump your feet out to the side and raise your arms above your head. Immediately reverse the motion to return to the starting position. Repeat in a rhythmic fashion.

name: High Knees
instructions: Stand in place and run, driving your knees up towards your chest as high as you can. Keep your core engaged and pump your arms in sync with your legs.

name: Butt Kicks
instructions: Stand in place and jog, focusing on kicking your heels back to touch your glutes. Keep your movements light and quick.

name: Arm Circles
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and extend your arms straight out to your sides. Make small circles with your arms, gradually increasing the size. After 15 seconds, reverse the direction of the circles.

name: Torso Twists
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hands on your hips or crossed over your chest. Gently twist your upper body from side to side. Keep your hips stable and focus the movement in your spine.

name: Leg Swings (Forward)
instructions: Stand holding onto a wall or stable object for balance. Swing one leg forward and backward in a controlled motion. Keep your core tight and your upper body still. Switch legs after 15 seconds.

name: Leg Swings (Side-to-Side)
instructions: Stand facing a wall, holding on for balance. Swing one leg out to the side and then across the front of your body. Keep the movement controlled. Switch legs after 15 seconds.

name: Bodyweight Squats
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your hips back and down as if sitting in a chair, keeping your chest up and your back straight. Go as low as you comfortably can, then push through your heels to return to the start.

name: Cat-Cow Stretch
instructions: Start on your hands and knees. Inhale as you drop your belly towards the floor and look up (Cow). Exhale as you round your spine up towards the ceiling and tuck your chin to your chest (Cat). Flow between the two positions.

name: Inchworms
instructions: From a standing position, hinge at your hips and walk your hands out into a high plank position. Keep your legs as straight as possible. Once in the plank, walk your feet in towards your hands. Stand up and repeat.

name: Hip Circles
instructions: Stand on one leg, holding onto something for balance if needed. Lift the other knee to a 90-degree angle and make large, controlled circles with your hip. Go clockwise for 15 seconds, then counter-clockwise for 15 seconds. Switch legs.

name: Walking Lunges
instructions: Step forward with one leg and lower your hips until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle. Ensure your front knee is directly above your ankle. Push off your back foot and step forward into a lunge with the opposite leg. Continue alternating.

name: Bird-Dog
instructions: Start on all fours. Simultaneously extend your right arm forward and your left leg backward, keeping your back flat and your hips level. Hold for a moment, then return to the start. Alternate sides.

name: Thoracic Spine Windmills
instructions: Start on all fours. Place one hand behind your head. Rotate your elbow down towards your opposite wrist, then rotate it up towards the ceiling, following your elbow with your eyes. Complete all reps on one side before switching.

name: Glute Bridge
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Place your arms by your sides. Lift your hips off the floor until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees. Squeeze your glutes at the top. Hold for a moment, then lower back down.

name: Downward-Facing Dog
instructions: Start on your hands and knees. Lift your hips up and back, forming an inverted V-shape with your body. Keep your head between your upper arms and press your heels towards the floor. You can pedal your feet to deepen the calf stretch.

name: Cobra Pose (Dynamic)
instructions: Lie on your stomach with your hands under your shoulders. Gently press up, lifting your chest off the floor while keeping your hips on the ground. Look forward and feel the stretch in your lower back and abdominals. Lower down and repeat in a flowing motion.

name: Shoulder Rolls
instructions: Stand tall with your arms at your sides. Slowly roll your shoulders up, back, and down in large circles. Complete several rolls backward, then reverse direction and roll forward. Focus on smooth, controlled movements.

name: Arm Swings (Cross-Body)
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Swing your right arm across your body to the left, then back out to the right. Continue swinging back and forth across your body. Switch arms after 15 seconds.

name: Knee-to-Chest Walk
instructions: Stand tall and slowly walk forward. With each step, bring your knee up towards your chest and give it a gentle hug with your hands before placing your foot down. Alternate legs with each step.

name: Lateral Leg Swings
instructions: Stand next to a wall for support. Swing one leg out to the side and then across the front of your body. Keep the movement controlled and your upper body stable. Switch legs after 15 seconds.

name: Bear Crawl Hold
instructions: Start on your hands and knees. Lift your knees just a few inches off the ground, keeping your back flat and core tight. Hold this position while breathing normally. This activates your entire core and shoulders.

name: Ankle Circles
instructions: Stand on one leg, holding onto something for balance if needed. Lift your other foot and make slow, controlled circles with your ankle. Go clockwise for 15 seconds, then counter-clockwise. Switch feet.

name: World's Greatest Stretch
instructions: Start in a lunge position with your right foot forward. Place your left hand on the ground inside your right foot. Rotate your right arm up towards the ceiling, opening your chest. Hold briefly, then return to center. Switch sides.

name: Leg Cradle Walk
instructions: Walk forward while bringing one knee up and across your body. Grab your shin and ankle, pulling your leg towards your chest in a 'cradle' position. Take a step and repeat with the other leg. This opens the hips dynamically.

name: Scapular Wall Slides
instructions: Stand with your back against a wall, arms in a 'goal post' position with elbows and wrists touching the wall. Slowly slide your arms up the wall while maintaining contact, then back down. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together.

name: Hip Circles (Standing)
instructions: Stand with your hands on your hips, feet shoulder-width apart. Make large, slow circles with your hips, going clockwise for 30 seconds, then counter-clockwise for 30 seconds. Keep your upper body stable.
